posts._title: Nikola Tanhofer – Osma vrata AKA The Eighth Door (1959)
posts.title: Osma vrata
posts.excerpt: Quote:The film takes place in Belgrade during the German occupation in World War II. The main character is Predrag Simonović, played by Milivoje Živanović, a professor who is not concerned with politics and war, but who accidentally comes into possession of a list of resistance movement members and becomes involved.

posts._title: Juraj Jakubisko – Mal’ované na dreve AKA Painted on Wood (1979)
posts.title: Mal’ované na dreve
posts.excerpt: A rare film by Juraj Jakubisko about the power of music.

posts._title: István Szöts – Melyiket a kilenc közül? AKA Which of the Nine? (1956)
posts.title: Melyiket a kilenc közül?
posts.excerpt: Istvan Szőts’s short, Christmas-themed film starring József Bihari and Andor Ajtay, based on Mór Jókai’s novel of the same title. The premier of the film was in the Venice Film Festival in 1957, where it received recognition. Only a TV-rip is available at the moment.

posts._title: Jean-Marie Straub – Einleitung zu Arnold Schoenbergs Begleitmusik zu einer Lichtspielscene AKA Introduction to Arnold Schoenberg’s Accompaniment to a Cinematic Scene (1973)(HD)
posts.title: Einleitung zu Arnold Schoenbergs Begleitmusik zu einer Lichtspielscene
posts.excerpt: Quote:In 1923, sensing the gathering storm of “fear, danger, and catastrophe” in Germany, the composer Arnold Schoenberg wrote a devastatingly prescient and heartbreaking letter to his former friend, the painter Wassily Kandinsky. Schoenberg aligned his fate with that of all Jews, knowing they were soon to face exile or violent death. Straub-Huillet’s film, a recitation …
posts.titleEnglish: Introduction to Arnold Schoenberg’s Accompaniment to a Cinematic Scene

posts._title: Lütfi Akad & Memduh Ün – Üç tekerlekli bisiklet AKA The Tricycle (1962)
posts.title: Üç tekerlekli bisiklet
posts.excerpt: IMDB:In the absence of his father, a little boy and his mother live by themselves on a poor suburb for years. Boy impatiently waits his father’s return, till the day a wounded outlaw takes refuge in their home.

posts.title: Perfect Strangers
posts.excerpt: Quote:A hit-man tries to seduce the mother of a child who witnessed his most recent kill.

posts._title: Chester Erskine – A Girl in Every Port (1952)
posts.title: A Girl in Every Port
posts.excerpt: Quote:Inheriting $1,450 upon the death of his aunt, gullible sailor Tim Dunnovan (William Bendix) purchases a race horse, to the dismay of his best friend, Benny Linn (Groucho Marx), who assumes Tim has been swindled. Tim and Benny learn that the horse, Little Erin, has weak ankles and is a poor racer — but his …

posts._title: Chunya Chai – Wo guxiang siwang de si zhong fangshi AKA Four Ways to Die in My Hometown (2012)
posts.title: Wo guxiang siwang de si zhong fangshi
posts.excerpt: Journalist-turned-filmmaker Chai Chunya was born in a village in Gansu, the Chinese province adjoining Tibet, and he returned there to shoot this remarkable debut feature. The story he tells is poetic, even fanciful: Ga Gui, a young woman who left to find education and work in the big city, visits her home village because she’s …
posts.titleEnglish: Four Ways to Die in My Hometown

posts._title: Yavuz Turgul – Ask Filmlerinin Unutulmaz Yönetmeni (1990)
posts.title: Ask Filmlerinin Unutulmaz Yönetmeni
posts.excerpt: Quote:Hasmet, director of love stories, wants to make a film with a “social content”. He makes a deal with the producer Abdulkadir, yet the actress Mujde Ar doesn’t accept the leading role, as Hasmet expected. Hasmet gives the role to Jeyan. He starts to shoot with a very limited budget. In the meantime the producer …
